summary: This document appears to be a legal or financial document outlining provisions of the JEFFREY EPSTEIN INSURANCE TRUST NO. 2 and The 2001 JEFFREY E. EPSTEIN INSURANCE TRUST. It specifies payment obligations of at least $10 million to a beneficiary, with trustees having discretion over income and principal distributions.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named in the trust documents as the individual whose insurance trusts are being described, with provisions for payments to a beneficiary.

keyFacts: The JEFFREY EPSTEIN INSURANCE TRUST NO. 2 is obligated to pay at least $10,000,000 to a beneficiary, with trustees making up any shortfall.
The 2001 JEFFREY E. EPSTEIN INSURANCE TRUST has a similar $10,000,000 payment obligation to a trust established under it.
Trustees have discretion to pay income and principal from the trust to the beneficiary at any time during the trust's continuance.
The beneficiary is to receive remaining principal upon the later of a specified individual's death or the beneficiary attaining age 35.
The document shows Epstein used complex trust structures with significant financial obligations, potentially for estate planning or asset protection.
